July 22, 1968
Fourth Report on Programming for the Disadvantaged
Ken Clark, Project Director
Your response to the need for information between stations has
been encouraging. I urge you to continue sharing in the dialogue.
As this Fourth Report on Programming will indicate, much is being done.
HOT PRODUCTIONS:
WQLN, Erie is underway with a public forum in which black members
of the community are taking an active participation. Prejudice,
Housing, Job Opportunities have been treated so far with strong viewer
reaction. In addition, one full discussion aired concerned.young
people and their attitudes toward Life as they see it. The series
continues with journeys through Mental Health, The Arts, Local Edu¬
cation, Urban-Suburban Annexation and other local interest topics.
A strong station commitment toward a balanced black-white exchange
suggests WQLN is in this program area to stay.
CONTACT: Robert J. Chitester, General Manager
In Florida, the Dade County Community Relations Board and the
Community Television Foundation are moving with a daily program through
which they hope to communicate with young Negroes. ”Itfs Our Bag" has
a magazine format with a variety of features. ItTs interesting to
note that the show’s T,JobTs for Real” insert was cancelled because
promised jobs for youth in that part of the country failed to materialize.
However other features make the series a lively weekday half hour.
Producer Bea Baxter enlisted the militant United Black Students
at the University of Miami to take charge of the "We Are History"
segment providing research, scripts and visuals. Meetings of the
Dade County Youth Council which often zero in on the dropout and
militancy scenes are taped live.
A regular newscast called "News in Black and White" with one
black youth and one white youth sharing the newscasting honors has
caught the viewers’ interest.
Another weekly feature, "Law and Justice" has black younsters
talking to local law enforcement officers and ... by pre-arrangement.••
no holds are barred as the kids ask the hard questions that affect
their daily lives.
